thread.title: Police launch search for missing 12-year-old girl who vanished walking home from top grammar school
thread.title_full: Police launch search for missing 12-year-old girl who vanished walking home from top grammar school

author: Joshua Taylor
title: Police launch search for missing 12-year-old girl who vanished walking home from top grammar school
text:
Shahrin Ahmed's family are worried for her safety (Photo: West Midlands Police) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Police have launched a search for a missing 12-year-old girl who vanished while walking home from a top grammar school. 
Shahrin Ahmed was last seen at 3.45pm yesterday afternoon leaving Queen Mary's School in Walsall and failed to return home. 
She was wearing her school uniform, a green jumper, light green shirt and carrying a black Nike bag. 
The teenager has never been missing before and her disappearance is described as "totally out of character". 
Police have made an urgent appeal for anyone who may have seen the youngster to get in touch. Queen Mary's High School in Walsall, where the schoolgirl was last seen (Photo: Google Streetview) Read More Fears for mum and eight-year-old son missing in Scottish Highlands 
A police spokesman said: "If you know where Shahrin is then please call us asap - her family are really worried and we need to make sure she is okay." 
A West Midlands Police statement added: "Shahrin has never been missing before and this is totally out of character for her. 
"Police are now urging anyone who may know of her whereabouts, to come forward." 
Queen Mary's High School is an all girls' grammar school founded in 1893. 
It has a GCSE pass rate of 98.4% - one of the highest in the country. 
Notable former alumni include The Kumars at No 42 comedian Meera Syal. 
Anyone with information can call police on 101 or the Missing People charity on 116 000. Like us on Facebook
